description: From Old French flebothomie (French phlébotomie), from Late Latin phlebotomia, from Ancient Greek φλεβοτόμος (phlebotómos, “that opens a vein”), from φλέψ (phléps, “vein”). Synchronically (by surface analysis), phlebo- +‎ -tomy.

entries.meaning: The opening of a vein, either to withdraw blood or for letting blood; venesection.
